channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: 4 Iraqi men, 1 Iranian sentenced to life in prison for killing US citizen in Baghdad
item.description: Four men from Iraq and another from Iran were sentenced to life in prison for killing an American in Baghdad. The American was from Tennessee.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Ex-Thai PM Thaksin Shinawatra, who recently began serving 8-year prison sentence, requests royal pardon
item.description: Thaksin Shinawatra, the former prime minister of Thailand, recently began serving an eight-year prison sentence. Shinawatra requested a royal pardon on Aug. 31, 2023.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: ICE sends deportation flight to Haiti after warning US citizens to evacuate
item.description: The Biden administration is conducting a deportation flight to Haiti on Thursday, a day after the State Department called on all U.S. citizens to leave the country immediately due to security concerns. The scheduled deportation flight, the second to Haiti this month, left Alexandria, La.
item.dc:creator: Rafael Bernal, The Hill

item.title: ICE sends deportation flight to Haiti after warning US citizens to evacuate
item.description: The Biden administration is conducting a deportation flight to Haiti on Thursday, a day after the State Department called on all U.S. citizens to leave the country immediately due to security concerns. The scheduled deportation flight, the second to Haiti this month, left Alexandria, La.
item.dc:creator: Rafael Bernal, The Hill

item.title: China's Xi likely to join Putin in skipping G20 summit next month: report
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will not attend the upcoming G20 summit in New Delhi for an unexplained reason, a report says.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Germany’s first giant pandas celebrate 4th birthday with cake ahead of trip to China
item.description: Germany’s first giant pandas, who were given by Beijing, celebrated their fourth birthday in Berlin Thursday before embarking on a COVID-delayed trip to China.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Iran accuses Israel of supplying potentially exploding parts for ballistic missile program
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Iran accused Israel on Thursday of trying to sabotage its ballistic missile program through faulty foreign parts that could explode, damaging or destroying the weapons before they could be used.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: North Korea, Russia arms deal 'actively advancing' says National Security Council
item.description: North Korea and Russia are in talks, moving towards a potential weapons deal, according to the National Security Council on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Niger's military regime orders police to expel French ambassador and revokes his diplomatic immunity
item.description: DAKAR, Senegal (AP) — Niger's military junta has revoked the diplomatic immunity of France's ambassador and ordered police to expel him from the West African country, according to a statement from the military regime.
item.dc:creator: SAM MEDNICK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine has developed a long-range weapon, a day after a strike deep inside Russia
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Thursday his country has developed a weapon that hit a target 700 kilometers (400 miles) away, in an apparent reference to the previous day’s strike on an airport in western Russia.
item.dc:creator: AP, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Greece reinforces firefighting forces as a massive wildfire in the northeast burns for a 13th day
item.description: ATHENS, Greece (AP) — Greek authorities further reinforced firefighting forces in the country’s northeast Thursday, where a massive blaze in its 13th day has flared up once more and prompted authorities to alert area residents to be on standby for possible evacuation.
item.dc:creator: ELENA BECATOROS, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: North Korea says it simulated nuclear attack on South, rehearsed occupation
item.description: North Korea said it simulated a “scorched earth” nuclear attack on South Korea on Thursday and an ensuing land occupation.
item.dc:creator: Nick Robertson, The Hill

item.title: Some in Africa are celebrating the coups. Many are fed up and desperate for change, analysts say
item.description: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) — After mutinous soldiers in Gabon announced they had deposed the country’s president, many residents danced in the streets and declared themselves free from the presidential family’s 55-year rule.
item.dc:creator: CHINEDU ASADU, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: US 'deeply concerned' about 'evolving events' in Gabon
item.description: An apparent coup in Gabon has U.S. officials “deeply concerned,” a State Department release said Wednesday evening.
item.dc:creator: Nick Robertson, The Hill

item.title: Gabon election results were a 'smokescreen' for soldiers to oust unpopular president, analysts say
item.description: DAKAR, Senegal (AP) — The ouster of Gabon's president by mutinous soldiers appears to have been well organized and capitalized on the population's grievances against the government as an excuse to seize power, analysts said.
item.dc:creator: SAM MEDNICK, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: North Korea says it simulated nuclear attacks on South Korea and rehearsed occupation of its rival
item.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korea said Thursday its latest missile launches simulated “scorched earth” nuclear strikes on South Korea and that it’s also been rehearsing an occupation of its rival’s territory in the event of conflict.
item.dc:creator: HYUNG-JIN KIM, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: A Palestinian kills an Israeli soldier in a West Bank truck ramming attack and is fatally shot
item.description: Israeli authorities say a Palestinian driver slammed his truck into soldiers at a busy checkpoint in the occupied West Bank, killing one of them before being shot dead.
item.dc:creator: Tia Goldenberg, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: At least 73 are dead, many of them homeless, as fire rips through a rundown building in South Africa
item.description: Authorities say at least 73 people have died in Johannesburg when a nighttime fire ripped through a five-story building that had been used by homeless people and squatters.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Rain and a wrong address delayed firefighters reaching a Philippine factory blaze. 15 people died
item.description: A fire has killed 15 people in a small apparel factory in a Philippine residential area, where flooding, traffic and a wrong address delayed firefighters.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Mutineers in Gabon appoint a military leader after detaining the president, alleging corruption
item.description: LIBREVILLE, Gabon (AP) — Mutinous soldiers in Gabon proclaimed their republican guard chief as the country’s leader Wednesday after placing the just-reelected President Ali Bongo Ondimba under house arrest, alleging betrayal and massive embezzlement during his long-time rule over the oil-rich Centra
item.dc:creator: YVES LAURENT GOMA and SAM MEDNICK, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Ukrainian drones strike deep in Russian territory, Moscow says, while a barrage in Kyiv kills 2
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine sent waves of drones deep into western Russia in more than four hours of nighttime attacks that struck military assets, Russian officials and media reports said Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: SUSIE BLANN and DASHA LITVINOVA, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: First US military transfer to Taiwan approved under program for sovereign states
item.description: The Biden administration has approved the first-ever U.S. military transfer to Taiwan under a program that is generally reserved for sovereign states. A spokesperson for the State Department confirmed to The Hill that it notified Congress of the sale on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Miranda Nazzaro, The Hill

item.title: Japanese ministers eat Fukushima fish to show it's safe after nuclear plant wastewater is discharged
item.description: TOKYO (AP) — Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and three Cabinet ministers ate Fukushima fish sashimi at a lunch meeting Wednesday, in an apparent effort to show that fish is safe following the release of treated radioactive wastewater from the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant that began las
item.dc:creator: MARI YAMAGUCHI, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: US citizens urged to leave Haiti immediately
item.description: The State Department urged all U.S. citizens to leave Haiti on Wednesday, strengthening previous warnings over safety concerns in the country. “Given the current security situation and infrastructure challenges, U.S.
item.dc:creator: Nick Robertson, The Hill

item.title: White House says Putin and Kim Jong Un traded letters as Russia looks for munitions from North Korea
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The White House on Wednesday said that it has new intelligence that shows Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un have swapped letters as Russia looks to North Korea for munitions for the war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: AAMER MADHANI, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Russia earns less from oil and spends more on war. So far, sanctions are working like a slow poison
item.description: The Russian currency has stabilized after dipping below 100 rubles to the U.S. dollar — but that doesn't mean the pressure is off Russia's economy.
item.dc:creator: David Mchugh, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Russian mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin is buried in private, ending his tumultuous journey
item.description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia (AP) — A private burial was held for Yevgeny Prigozhin, ending a tumultuous journey from St.
item.dc:creator: AP, NewsNation

item.title: Neurosurgeon investigating patient's mystery symptoms plucks worm from woman's brain
item.description: A neurosurgeon investigating a woman’s mystery symptoms in an Australian hospital says she plucked a wriggling worm from the patient’s brain.
item.dc:creator: ROD McGUIRK Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: US, Chinese commerce leaders meet: 'Huge progress'
item.description: Following a meeting in Beijing Monday, commerce leaders promised to improve communication between the United States and China, a signal that tensions could be easing.
item.dc:creator: Raquel Martin, WGN 9

item.title: British bog snorkeling championship contenders race through slime
item.description: Intrepid athletes donned snorkels and slithered through slime on Sunday during one of Britain’s quirkiest sporting events: the World Bog Snorkeling Championships.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Virginia man stolen at birth meets Chilean family for first time
item.description: A 42-year-old Virginia man got to embrace his birth mother for the first time during a long-awaited family reunion in Valdivia, Chile.
item.dc:creator: Taylor Delandro, NewsNation

item.title: Bog snorkeling championships: Competitors race through slime in British contest
item.description: Intrepid athletes donned snorkels and slithered through slime on Sunday during one of Britain’s quirkiest sporting events: the World Bog Snorkeling Championships.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: 8 US Marines remain in a hospital after a fiery aircraft crash killed 3 during drills in Australia
item.description: CANBERRA, Australia (AP) — Eight U.S. Marines remained in a hospital in the Australian north coast city of Darwin on Monday after they were injured in a fiery crash of a tiltrotor aircraft that killed three of their colleagues on an island.
item.dc:creator: ROD McGUIRK, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: With drones and webcams, volunteer hunters join new search for mythical Loch Ness Monster
item.description: Mystery hunters converged on a Scottish lake on Saturday to look for signs of the mythical Loch Ness Monster.
item.dc:creator: Jill Lawless, WFLA, NBC

item.title: From tarantulas to tigers, zoo animals step onto scales for annual weigh-in
item.description: Staff at London Zoo got the measure of giant gorillas, plump penguins and skinny stick insects at the zoo’s annual animal weigh-in on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: FIFA opens case against Spanish soccer official who kissed player on lips at Women's World Cup
item.description: FIFA opened a disciplinary case Thursday against the Spanish soccer official who kissed a player on the lips while celebrating the team's victory in the Women’s World Cup final.
item.dc:creator: Graham Dunbar, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Putin breaks silence on plane crash that presumably killed Wagner leaders
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has broken his silence on the plane crash that killed top leaders of the Wagner mercenary group.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC
